definition: to join up/to enlist (e.g. in the military)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: I've aspired to join the army to serve my country ever since childhood.
sentences.chinese: 我从小就立下了投军报国的志向。

sentences.english: Comprised of hunters from throughout the Baltic region, these men seek to earn a living serving in local militias and armies.
sentences.chinese: 这些波罗的海猎户为了生计需要，毅然投军作战。

definition: to enlist/to serve in the army
to enlist/to be in the army
to serve in the army/to be a soldier
to lay down the pen and take up the sword (idiom)/to join the military (esp. of educated person)
to take up an official post
to send armed forces to suppress
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
